description:
The Warring States Period is a time of feuding warlords. Oda Nobunaga, the greatest of them all, is reborn in modern-day Japan... as a shiba-inu! The other generals of the era, too, have also inexplicably been reborn as dogs. Their warring states rivalry will resume at the dog park!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Primarily Animal Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed animal or animal-like characters.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

alternative: マリー・アントワネット

node.description:
[Website](https://kumaka.jp/) | [Profile (Apollo Bay)](https://apollobay.jp/talent/熊田茜音/) | [Profile (Amuse)](https://artist.amuse.co.jp/artist/kumada_akane/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/official_kumaka) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kumadakane_official/)

Akane Kumada is a Japanese voice actress and singer. She is affiliated with Apollo Bay and made her voice acting debut in 2018.

Shinji Miyazaki  is a Japanese composer and arranger. He was born in Kobe, and lived in a variety of areas on the island of Shikoku for much of his childhood. He developed a taste for pop music, which eventually led him to study musical arrangement and piano instruction at the Shobi College of Music. He took some time in deciding that music would become his career, but eventually decided to become an arranger, and later a composer.

His work has dealt primarily with musical scores for anime. His most well known contributions include music for the Crayon Shin-chan series and music for much of the Pokémon anime series and most of the films in it from 1997 to 2019. His work pulls from many inspirations, among them J-Pop and American pop influences, as well as jazz artist Gil Evans. Many of his compositions utilize string and brass instruments, particularly the french horn.

(Source: Wikipedia)
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KA_Yuuzumi)

A Japanese director, animator, and storyboard artist who mainly does key animation and animation direction.

[Website (Hedworks)](http://hedworks.sakura.ne.jp/info.html) | [Twitter (Hedworks)](https://twitter.com/hed_works)

The president of Hedworks, a company that produces background art for anime and games.

_Note: Not to be confused with either of the two animators, [佐藤雅弘](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and [佐藤正博](https://anilist.co/staff/222513/)._
